content:
• Monday, October 1, 2012
  • KRO

    Kronos Worldwide (NYSE:KRO) lowers guidance for its Q3, now seeing an EPS of between $0.26 -...

    Kronos Worldwide (NYSE:KRO) lowers guidance for its Q3, now seeing an EPS of between $0.26 - $0.29, below consensus estimates of $0.39. The company blames the miss on weak segment profit impacted by unabsorbed fixed overhead costs due to lower sales and production volumes and higher feedstock ore costs. Net income is also expected to be lower, ranging between $30M - $34M, compared to $85.9M in 3Q11. Shares -1.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:35 PM
  • ANDX

    Tesoro Logistics (TLLP) -4.1% AH after announcing a public offering of 3.7M common units...

    Tesoro Logistics (TLLP) -4.1% AH after announcing a public offering of 3.7M common units representing limited partner interests. TLLP says it expects to use net proceeds for general partnership purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:14 PM
  • PETM

    PetSmart (NASDAQ:PETM) +2.5% AH on news the stock will be added to the S&P 500 after the...

    PetSmart (NASDAQ:PETM) +2.5% AH on news the stock will be added to the S&P 500 after the close on Oct. 4, replacing Sunoco (NYSE:SUN) following the latter's buyout by ETP. Cabela's (NYSE:CAB) will replace PETM in the S&P MidCap 400; Acorda Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ACOR) will replace CAB in the S&P SmallCap 600.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM
  • WPP-OLD

    Wausau Paper (NYSE:WPP-OLD) cuts its FY12 earnings view, saying that its paper segment earnings...

    Wausau Paper (NYSE:WPP-OLD) cuts its FY12 earnings view, saying that its paper segment earnings in both Q3 and Q4 will be adversely impacted by lower profit at its Brainerd, Minnesota, facility, as well as slumping demand in its economically sensitive industrial product categories. The company now expects to earn between $0.28 to $0.30 per share on a FY basis, below the $0.39 to $0.41 per share range previously estimated. Shares -2.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:14 PM
  • BTH

    Blyth (NYSE:BTH) +12.5% AH after announcing it has reached a deal to defer the full purchase of...

    Blyth (NYSE:BTH) +12.5% AH after announcing it has reached a deal to defer the full purchase of its ViSalus subsidiary, in which Blythe owns a 73% stake, until April 2014, and that the purchase price will be based on ViSalus' 2013 EBITDA. In addition, Blyth has agreed to new 5-year contracts with ViSalus' CEO and CMO. Blyth was crushed last week after ViSalus withdrew its IPO. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM
  • PNR

    Pentair (NYSE:PNR) says its board has authorized an additional $800M stock buyback , to expire...

    Pentair (NYSE:PNR) says its board has authorized an additional $800M stock buyback , to expire on December 31, 2015. The authorization is in addition to the $400M repurchase program announced on September 28, giving the company an aggregate amount of $1.2B which is consistent with its March, 2012 merger announcement. Share -4.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • GEL

    Genesis Energy (NYSE:GEL) -5.9% AH after announcing a secondary offering of 6M common units...

    Genesis Energy (NYSE:GEL) -5.9% AH after announcing a secondary offering of 6M common units representing limited partner interests by Quintana Capital Group and certain affiliates and other selling unitholders. GEL will not receive any of the proceeds from the sale.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • CLB

    Core Labs (NYSE:CLB) -4.6% AH after disclosing it expects Q3 results below prior guidance given...

    Core Labs (NYSE:CLB) -4.6% AH after disclosing it expects Q3 results below prior guidance given in its Q2 earnings release and subsequent earnings conference call. CLB now sees Q3 revenues at $240M-$245M vs. prior guidance of $250M-$260M and $255.7M consensus, with EPS at $1.09-$1.13 vs. prior $1.17-$1.25 and $1.23 consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • TISI

    Team (NASDAQ:TISI) FQ1 EPS of $0.36 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $161M (+14% Y/Y) beats by $6M....

    Team (NASDAQ:TISI) FQ1 EPS of $0.36 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $161M (+14% Y/Y) beats by $6M. Shares -4.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • SLCA

    U.S. Silica (SLCA +6.4%) finishes higher after announcing a few management changes. William...

    U.S. Silica (SLCA +6.4%) finishes higher after announcing a few management changes. William White, the company's CFO, will retire at the end of the year. Donald Merril, who was appointed vice president of Finance, will assume the CFO position upon White's retirement. The company also says that Brian Slobodow, it's chief administrative officer, will resign as an executive officer, effective October 7, 2012, but will continue to serve on the board of directors.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • NFLX

    Whitney Tilson went on CNBC to sing Netflix's (NFLX +2.9%) praises again, and that helped its...

    Whitney Tilson went on CNBC to sing Netflix's (NFLX +2.9%) praises again, and that helped its beaten-down shares outperform. Tilson suggested Netflix resembles Amazon 10 years ago, when Amazon's shares were hammered by the Dot.com bubble fallout and its survival questioned. He also addressed fears of rising content costs by arguing Netflix only has to outbid rivals with less video revenue. But what if studios refuse to license below a certain price due to the impact Netflix has on other revenue streams? (previous)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 3 Comments
  • S

    Sprint (S -6.3%) is ending the day lower courtesy of a downgrade to Market Perform from Raymond...

    Sprint (S -6.3%) is ending the day lower courtesy of a downgrade to Market Perform from Raymond James, which cites valuation. Shares have now fallen 10% since making new 52-week highs last Tuesday.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM | 9 Comments
  • SAM

    Boston Beer (SAM -2.6%) is cut to a Sell rating by UBS, which points to stalling demand for the...

    Boston Beer (SAM -2.6%) is cut to a Sell rating by UBS, which points to stalling demand for the brewer's Twisted Tea malts and Angry Orchard ciders. "The abrupt flattening suggests the easy distribution opportunities are behind the brands, and same-store sales growth will be the focus - posing downside risk to consensus revenue growth estimates," the firm says.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM
  • SANW

    S&W Seed (SANW +10.2%) trades higher today after spending $6M to acquire Imperial Valley...

    S&W Seed (SANW +10.2%) trades higher today after spending $6M to acquire Imperial Valley Seeds, a marketer of non-dormant alfalfa seed varieties to international markets in the Middle East, North Africa and Latin America.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM
  • BRP

    Brookfield Residential (BRP +5.3%) shoots higher after a positive presentation from Mick McGuire...

    Brookfield Residential (BRP +5.3%) shoots higher after a positive presentation from Mick McGuire at the Value Investing Congress. BRP boasts 30 years' worth of undervalued property, says Marcato Capital's McGuire; he also likes Alexander & Baldwin (ALEX -2.4%) and GenCorp (GY +3.4%) on the basis of their undervalued real estate assets.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM | 1 Comment
  • CBLI

    Cleveland BioLabs (CBLI -3%) slips after saying it's received the end-of-Phase 2 meeting minutes...

    Cleveland BioLabs (CBLI -3%) slips after saying it's received the end-of-Phase 2 meeting minutes from the FDA, along with an advice letter which clarifies the remaining clinical study protocols for the development of its Entolimod as a radiation countermeasure. The firm says the agency is committed to moving the Entolimod program forward, but it has some requests regarding several aspects of the proposed plan for dose conversion.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM | 1 Comment
  • NTR

    From Josh Brown's notes on Jana's pitch for Agrium (AGU +2.2%) as a value play: AGU has...

    From Josh Brown's notes on Jana's pitch for Agrium (AGU +2.2%) as a value play: AGU has historically trailed a weighted average of its peers by 66% over the past five years. The thrust of Jana's gripe with AGU management is that working capital decisions are being made recklessly and the retail business is misunderstood. Jana's statements are "nothing new," AGU says.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM
  • ELY

    Callaway Golf (ELY +4.2%) tees off after Raymond James upped it to Strong Buy earlier today,...

    Callaway Golf (ELY +4.2%) tees off after Raymond James upped it to Strong Buy earlier today, saying that after four years of losing money, it expects the golf equipment maker to return to profitabiilty next year. The firm notes ELY's revamped product line and new marketing campaign due to be launched in 2013, which it anticipates will revive the brand name.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • MLI

    Buckingham gives a boost to Mueller Industries (MLI +4.7%) today, raising it to Buy and saying...

    Buckingham gives a boost to Mueller Industries (MLI +4.7%) today, raising it to Buy and saying an upturn in the residential housing market should help the copper tubing provider's bottom line sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • NOK

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU -3.2%) falls towards the $1 level once again thanks to a downgrade to Sell...

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU -3.2%) falls towards the $1 level once again thanks to a downgrade to Sell from UBS. The firm is worried about weak fixed-line capex in Europe, a lack of a recovery for Chinese demand, and the need for asset sales to address the company's debt obligations. UBS has been (accurately) voicing concerns about telecom capex for a while.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM | 6 Comments
  • PCL

    Plum Creek Timber (PCL -2%) shares are downgraded to Neutral from Buy at D.A. Davidson based on...

    Plum Creek Timber (PCL -2%) shares are downgraded to Neutral from Buy at D.A. Davidson based on valuation. While the firm expects real estate to continue to improve into 2013, expectations are already discounted into PCL's valuation; absent acceleration beyond the current consensus of 900K units, the firm sees no catalyst to increase shares past $45.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM
  • BMC

    BMC Software (BMC +4.5%) spikes higher after the WSJ reports the company has hired BofA/Merrill...

    BMC Software (BMC +4.5%) spikes higher after the WSJ reports the company has hired BofA/Merrill to help find a buyer. The i-bank is said to be reaching out to software companies and P-E firms to gauge interest. BMC has already rallied this year on M&A hopes, as activist investor Elliott Associates prods the company to put itself on sale. Susquehanna gives BMC, which currently trades at $43, a sum-of-the-parts valuation of $54.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • SYNA

    Synaptics (SYNA -4.7%) falls on a downgrade to Sector Perform from Pac Crest's John Vinh, who...

    Synaptics (SYNA -4.7%) falls on a downgrade to Sector Perform from Pac Crest's John Vinh, who thinks the touchscreen controller vendor has lost significant Chinese smartphone share - MediaTek is named as a beneficiary. Also, Vinh is worried in-cell touch panel shortages, along with Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) 1-year exclusivity deals with LCD suppliers for in-cell panels, will affect Synaptics' in-cell controller sales. Rivals Atmel (ATML -0.9%) and Cypress Semi (CY -0.6%) are also lower. (Needham downgrade)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • NTR

    Agrium (AGU +2.4%) bounces on reports that Jana Partners says a spinoff of its retail unit could...

    Agrium (AGU +2.4%) bounces on reports that Jana Partners says a spinoff of its retail unit could add $50/share in value. AGU has been a top holding for Jana over the past few months, and the activist investor has been pushing it to find ways to boost shareholder value.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • TEG

    Integrys (TEG +3.8%) springs to highs of the day after D.A. Davidson upgrades shares to Buy with...

    Integrys (TEG +3.8%) springs to highs of the day after D.A. Davidson upgrades shares to Buy with a new $59 price target (up from $55) following TEG's purchase of the Fox Energy Center in Wisconsin. The firm says Fox potentially adds ~$20M to the utility's annual regulated earnings power and sets the stage for higher earnings in 2013 and a cash return in 2014.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • SPLK

    Splunk (SPLK -4%) dives after hedge fund manager Zack Buckley makes a short case for the company...

    Splunk (SPLK -4%) dives after hedge fund manager Zack Buckley makes a short case for the company at the Value Investing Congress. Buckley argues Splunk, the clear leader in the growing machine data software market, has an undifferentiated product and low recurring revenue, and faces tough competition from IT giants. Drexel Hamilton raised the issue of competition in May, though most analysts criticizing Splunk have chosen to focus on its valuation.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • GNVC

    Shares of biopharmaceutical developer GenVec (GNVC +4.4%) jump after releasing positive data on...

    Shares of biopharmaceutical developer GenVec (GNVC +4.4%) jump after releasing positive data on one of its RSV vaccine programs at a conference over the weekend. The company says data on its vaccine candidate showed it to be highly immunogenic and avoids the problems of vector specific immunity that has hampered other similar vectored vaccines.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • CONN

    Shares of Conn's (CONN +7.9%) pop after Canaccord Genuity dials up an upgrade to Buy on the...

    Shares of Conn's (CONN +7.9%) pop after Canaccord Genuity dials up an upgrade to Buy on the retailer. The company is moving in the opposite direction of its big box peers, with plans to increase its square footage by 20% in FY13-FY14 to make room for higher-margin items. One CONN diffentiator: In-house financing has been a growth driver for Conn's as its customers sign up for credit at one of the highest rates in the sector.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM
  • Z

    Zillow (Z -1.4%), hit hard by Citron Research last week, is slipping after Barclays' Mark May...

    Zillow (Z -1.4%), hit hard by Citron Research last week, is slipping after Barclays' Mark May starts coverage with an Equal Weight. May touts Zillow's ability to address a U.S. residential real estate market that sees $1T/year in transactions and $7B/year in agent/broker marketing spend, but considers all of this baked in at current levels. Yelp (YELP +2.3%) is also being started at Equal Weight on valuation grounds, but is trading higher nonetheless. A quarter of Yelp's float remained shorted as of Sep. 14.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • LAYN

    Layne Christensen (LAYN +8.6%) shares pop after Kian Ghazi of Hawkshaw Capital Management made...

    Layne Christensen (LAYN +8.6%) shares pop after Kian Ghazi of Hawkshaw Capital Management made positive comments on the water-well driller at the Value Investing Conference.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • MMM

    Midday top 10 gainers: CRDN +43%. FONR +34%. BIOF +19%. VSR +17%. MTG +16%. SNTA +16%. VSNT...

    Midday top 10 gainers: CRDN +43%. FONR +34%. BIOF +19%. VSR +17%. MTG +16%. SNTA +16%. VSNT +15%. PATK +14%. MGI +12%. SFUN +12%.
    Top 10 Losers: NC -65%. TYC -49%. GMAN -24%. BYFC -17%. THLD -17%. PPHM -16%. GNI -11%. OCZ -10%. ROSG-OLD -10%. CYTX -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • MGA

    Magna International (MGA +2.4%) strengthens its position in automotive pumps, agreeing to buy a...

    Magna International (MGA +2.4%) strengthens its position in automotive pumps, agreeing to buy a German maker of automotive vacuum, engine and transmission pumps for ~$397M and, in a separate purchase, acquiring the 50% stake it doesn't already own in STT Technologies, a supplier of transmission and engine-related oil pumps.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • HUSA

    Houston American Energy (HUSA -23.3%) resumes trading after a halt, plunging on news of a public...

    Houston American Energy (HUSA -23.3%) resumes trading after a halt, plunging on news of a public offering of more than 14.8M units at a purchase price of $0.675/unit. HUSA plans to use net proceeds from the offering for general working capital purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM | 1 Comment
  • EGC

    Energy XXI (EXXI +2.6%) pops higher after announcing its first horizontal well had the highest...

    Energy XXI (EXXI +2.6%) pops higher after announcing its first horizontal well had the highest oil rate ever produced in the West Delta 73 field since its discovery in 1962. EXXI also acquires shallow-water Gulf of Mexico assets from ExxonMobil (NYSE:XOM) and enters into a JV with XOM to explore for oil and gas in the Gulf.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • BIDU

    Baidu (BIDU -3.1%) slides after receiving a downgrade to Hold from Jefferies' Cynthia Meng. Like...

    Baidu (BIDU -3.1%) slides after receiving a downgrade to Hold from Jefferies' Cynthia Meng. Like many other analysts, Meng is worried about Qihoo's (QIHU -1.1%) search engine: she thinks Baidu's Q3 results will be at the low end of its guidance range, and that its numbers for Q4 and later could miss Street estimates. Meng also expects Baidu's traffic acquisition costs to rise as a % of sales. Baidu has already significantly underperformed the NASDAQ since Qihoo's search engine launched.  (more)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM | 1 Comment
  • DMND

    Diamond Foods (DMND -0.6%) racks up a gain after Litespeed Management discloses holding a 7.7%...

    Diamond Foods (DMND -0.6%) racks up a gain after Litespeed Management discloses holding a 7.7% stake in the company in a SEC filing (13G). It's a move that intrigues dealReporter on the premise that a cleaned up Diamond Foods with some serious investors behind the scenes could look enticing to any number of food companies looking for a tasty buy.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 1 Comment
  • CVI

    CVR Energy's (CVI +9%) refining unit files for an IPO of up to $300M, as the company looks...

    CVR Energy's (CVI +9%) refining unit files for an IPO of up to $300M, as the company looks to raise funds to pay down debt and for other purposes. Also, work resumes at CVI's Wynnewood refinery in Oklahoma, where a Sept. 28 explosion left one worker in critical condition and another dead.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • MDGL

    Synta Pharmaceuticals (SNTA +11.6%) pops after reporting encouraging results from its Phase 2b...

    Synta Pharmaceuticals (SNTA +11.6%) pops after reporting encouraging results from its Phase 2b Galaxy trial of ganetespib - the company's lead Hsp90 inhibitor - as second-line treatment for advanced non-small cell lung cancer. The company says test results showed good tolerability for the combination of ganetespib and docetaxel as well as meaningful improvements in overall survival in adenocarcinoma patients receiving the drug combination.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • MWW

    Shares of Monster Worldwide (MWW +5.2%) break higher with a word out that the company is in...

    Shares of Monster Worldwide (MWW +5.2%) break higher with a word out that the company is in advanced talks with a P-E firm about a buyout. Though shares of Monster Worldwide have been on a roller coaster ride as buyout chatter has come and gone, today's report has a bit more beef than previous scuttlebutt.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM
  • WEN

    Wendy's (WEN -5.6%) trades lower after taking on a downgrade from Janney Capital to Neutral from...

    Wendy's (WEN -5.6%) trades lower after taking on a downgrade from Janney Capital to Neutral from Buy as channel checks tip off the North American same-store sales are slowing. Slumping revenue for the company would be a double-whammy with higher beef prices starting to pressure margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • NSM

    Nationstar Mortgage (NSM +3%) continues to fly higher, suggesting speculation it may not win the...

    Nationstar Mortgage (NSM +3%) continues to fly higher, suggesting speculation it may not win the bidding for ResCap's servicing assets (or be forced to pay too high of a price) is just that. Nationstar has quickly raised $400M in two separate offerings over the past two weeks, apparently believing it is about to make a big acquisition. If it doesn't win, look out below.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • SUNEQ

    MEMC (WFR +4%) opens higher after announcing it has closed on a $200M term loan, secured by...

    MEMC (WFR +4%) opens higher after announcing it has closed on a $200M term loan, secured by nearly all of the company's assets. The loan carries a steep interest rate of LIBOR (minimum of 1.5%) + 9.25%, and features mandatory repayment provisions in the event of certain asset sales or new financing moves. MEMC had $1.8B in debt as of June 29, and has seen its cash flow situation deteriorate in tandem with its solar wafer sales. (S&P downgrade)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • GNRC

    Generac (NYSE:GNRC) +15.7% premarket after the designer and manufacturer of power generators...

    Generac (NYSE:GNRC) +15.7% premarket after the designer and manufacturer of power generators raises its revenue outlook for the year and offers an upbeat Q3 forecast, citing increased demand. GNRC cites recent major power-outage events and ramped-up marketing efforts as cause for the demand boost.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM | 1 Comment
  • MMM

    Premarket gainers: CRDN +42.98%. FONR +33.33%. MTG +18.95%. GNRC +17.87%. ZAGG +5.51%. Losers:...

    Premarket gainers: CRDN +42.98%. FONR +33.33%. MTG +18.95%. GNRC +17.87%. ZAGG +5.51%.
    Losers: PPHM -5.83%.
     
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • TPLM

    Energy-focused PE firm First Reserve and Triangle Petroleum (NYSEMKT:TPLM) form a JV aimed at...

    Energy-focused PE firm First Reserve and Triangle Petroleum (NYSEMKT:TPLM) form a JV aimed at resolving transportation bottlenecks plaguing energy producers in North Dakota's Bakken shale region. The new company will begin by constructing pipeline gathering systems connecting more than 100 far-flung oil and natural gas well sites to rail terminals. TPLM +1.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:04 AM | 1 Comment

  • Chicago Fed President Charles Evans - the man whose ideas about QE∞ won the day on the...

    Chicago Fed President Charles Evans - the man whose ideas about QE∞ won the day on the FOMC - tells CNBC he expects unemployment in the 7% range for at least another 2 years. As 7% is unacceptable to Evans, the statement means he expects a minimum 2 years of continued $40B/month or more of asset purchases. Gold and silver erase early losses. GLD +0.3%, SLV +2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:48 AM | 9 Comments
  • RIG

    Transocean (NYSE:RIG) +3.3% premarket after last night's announcement that a Brazilian court had...

    Transocean (NYSE:RIG) +3.3% premarket after last night's announcement that a Brazilian court had partially suspended the preliminary injunction order that required RIG to stop operating in Brazil within 30 days. RIG is permitted to continue to operate its rigs in all fields offshore Brazil except the Campo de Frade field.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:32 AM | 1 Comment
  • CHFS

    Sunshine Heart (SSH) up 19% premarket as it gets conditional FDA approval to move into a Q4...

    Sunshine Heart (SSH) up 19% premarket as it gets conditional FDA approval to move into a Q4 trial for its C-Pulse Heart Assist System. A 388-patient trial will see half being implanted with the system as part of a series of "timely approvals," SSH says.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:17 AM
  • GS

    Goldman Sachs (NYSE:GS) gaps higher 2% premarket after it gets the Barron's treatment in a good...

    Goldman Sachs (NYSE:GS) gaps higher 2% premarket after it gets the Barron's treatment in a good way over the weekend.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:07 AM
  • SEEL

    Shares of Apricus Biosciences (APRI) soar 11.1% premarket after the company announces that it...

    Shares of Apricus Biosciences (APRI) soar 11.1% premarket after the company announces that it will file a new drug submission in Canada for MycoVa in Q4 of 2013. In advanced testing, MycoVa has shown an ability to kill nail fungus and improve the appearance of nails.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:00 AM
  • GMAN

    Gordmans Stores (NASDAQ:GMAN) guides its outlook for Q3 and Q4 revenue lower after seeing sales...

    Gordmans Stores (NASDAQ:GMAN) guides its outlook for Q3 and Q4 revenue lower after seeing sales trends slow since Labor Day. The company now sees sales of $142M-$144M in Q3, down from prior guidance of $145M-$147M, and revenue of $213M-$215M in Q4, from $217M-$219M. Shares of GMAN -3.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:19 AM
  • BGS

    B&G Foods (NYSE:BGS) says it will offer 3.629M shares of its common stock pursuant to a shelf...

    B&G Foods (NYSE:BGS) says it will offer 3.629M shares of its common stock pursuant to a shelf registration statement with the SEC. The company plans to use the proceeds of the offering to help pay for recent acquisitions and for general corporate purposes. BGS -1.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:02 AM | 2 Comments
